sen.j: 多宝塔駅（たほうとうえき）は、京都府京都市左京区にある宗教法人鞍馬寺が運行するケーブルカー、鞍馬山鋼索鉄道の鉄道駅である。
sen.e: Tahoto Station is a stop of the Mount Kurama Cable Railway operated by Kurama-dera Temple, which is a religious corporation and located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Tahoto Station is a stop on the Mount Kurama Cable Railway operated by Kurama-dera Temple, a religious corporation located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Tahoto Station is a stop on the Mount Kurama Cable Railway operated by Kurama-dera Temple, a religious corporation located in Sakyo Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 鞍馬山鋼索鉄道の山上駅に相当し、その名のとおり鞍馬寺多宝塔に隣接する。
sen.e: Tahoto Station is a stopt of Mount Kurama Cable Railway, located on the top of the mountain; as the name shows, the station is adjacent to Tahoto (a 2-storied pagoda that developed from the circular, roofed one called houtou) of the Kurama-dera Temple.

Tahoto Station is a stop on the Mount Kurama Cable Railway, located on the top of the mountain; as the name implies, the station is adjacent to Tahoto (a two-story pagoda that developed from the circular, roofed one called a houtou) of Kurama-dera Temple.

Tahoto Station is a stop on the Mount Kurama Cable Railway, located on the top of the mountain; as the name implies, the station is adjacent to Tahoto (a two-story pagoda that developed from the circular, roofed one called a hoto) of Kurama-dera Temple.
Station layout
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 「多宝塔礼堂」という1957年にケーブルカー開通と同時に完成した仏堂が、駅舎を兼ねている。
sen.e: Tahoto Raido' (a worship hall), which is a Buddhist temple completed when the cable car was opened in 1957, serves as a station building.
Tahoto Raido (a worship hall),' which is a Buddhist temple completed when the cable car was opened in 1957, serves as a station building.
Tahoto Raido (a worship hall),' which is a Buddhist temple completed when the cable car was opened in 1957, serves as a station building.

sen.j: 多宝塔前の1階には駅入口があり、階段を下った地階に待合所と乗り場がある。
sen.e: The entrance of the station is on the first floor, in front of Tahoto, and the waiting room and the gate are on the basement floor, going down the stairs.
The entrance of the station is on the first floor, in front of Tahoto, and the waiting room and gate are downstairs on the basement level.
The entrance of the station is on the first floor, in front of Tahoto, and the waiting room and gate are downstairs on the basement level.

sen.j: 山門駅と異なり「ケーブル受付」という事実上の乗車券売場は係員室に併設されており、閑散期は多宝塔駅の運転係員が掛け持ちで受付を行う。
sen.e: Unlike Sanmon Station, the staff room has a practical ticket window called the 'cable reception'; in off seasons, operating staff of Tahoto Station collects tickets by himself.
Unlike Sanmon Station, the staff room has a practical ticket window called the 'cable reception'; in the off-season, a staff person of Tahoto Station collects tickets.
Unlike Sanmon Station, the staff room has a practical ticket window called the 'cable reception'; in the off-season, a staff person of Tahoto Station collects tickets.

sen.j: 乗り場の柱は山門駅と同様に朱塗りとなっている。
sen.e: The columns at the gate is vermilion-lacquered as in Sanmon Station.
The columns at the gate are vermilion-lacquered, as in Sanmon Station.
The columns at the gate are vermilion-lacquered, as in Sanmon Station.

sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.e: Kurama-dera Temple, Tahoto
Kurama-dera Temple, Tahoto
Kurama-dera Temple, Tahoto
Kurama-dera Temple, Honden Kondo (Hondo: main hall)
Kurama-dera Temple, Honden Kondo (Hondo: main hall)
Kurama-dera Temple, Honden Kondo (main golden hall) : This is the Hondo, which is the main hall.

sen.j: 鞍馬寺霊宝殿（鞍馬山博物館を併設）
sen.e: Kurama-dera Temple, Reiho-den Hall (which holds temple treasures) (The temple also has Kuramayama Museum.)
Kurama-dera Temple, Reiho-den Hall, holds temple treasures, and the temple also has Kuramayama Museum.
Kurama-dera Temple, Reiho-den Hall: This hall holds temple treasures; it also has Kuramayama Museum.
History
History
History

sen.j: 1957年（昭和32年）1月1日 鞍馬山鋼索鉄道の開通に伴い開業。
sen.e: On January 1, 1957 the station was opened when the Mount Kurama Cable Railway was established.
On January 1, 1957, the station was opened when the Mount Kurama Cable Railway was established.
January 1, 1957: The station was opened when the Mount Kurama Cable Railway was established.
sen.cmt: 日付、コロン の表現に変更しました。
